actions.text: On agreeing to the Comstock amendment (A026) Agreed to by voice vote.
Amendment (A026) offered by Mrs. Comstock to the Rules amendment (A001).
House amendment offered/reported by : Amendment (A026) offered by Mrs. Comstock to the Rules amendment (A001).
House amendment agreed to: On agreeing to the Comstock amendment (A026) Agreed to by voice vote.
Amendment agreed to Committee of the Whole

amends_amendment.description: Amendment consists of the text of Rules Committee print 114-32, as amended, and which was made in order pursuant to H. Res. 507.
amends_amendment.purpose: An amendment consisting of the text of Rules Committee print 114-32 which shall be considered as pending.

description: Amendment clarifies language in the bill regarding universities abilities to submit grant applications for the University Transportation Centers program as either the lead or partnering applicant; directs the Secretary of Transportation to develop a 5-year Strategic Plan for Transportation Research and Development; provides authority for the Transportation Assistant Secretary for Research and Technology to conduct research on how to reduce traffic congestion; and authorizes the Assistant Secretary to transmit a report to Congress on rail safety issues.
purpose: An amendment numbered 27 printed in Part B of House Report 114-325 to clarify the restrictions placed on institutions applying for UTC grants, and broadens the paragraph on "Focused Research" for regional UTCs. Directs the Secretary of Transportation to develop a 5-Year Transportation R&D Strategic Plan for FY 18 through FY 22. Authorizes the Assistant Secretary for Research and Technology to conduct a traffic congestion study. Authorizes the Assistant Secretary to submit a rail safety study to Congress.
